Class EnumerableExtensions

A few extra methods for composing with Linq.

Inheritance
System.Object
EnumerableExtensions
Namespace: FunctionalLink.Next
Assembly: FunctionalLink.Next.dll
Syntax
public static class EnumerableExtensions : Object

Methods

Evaluate<T>(IEnumerable<T>)

Forces the evaluation of an IEnumerable to a materialized collection that will not reevaluate.

Declaration
public static IReadOnlyCollection<T> Evaluate<T>(this IEnumerable<T> enumerable)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<T> enumerable

The target enumerable
Returns
Type Description
System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyCollection<T>

A collection that will not reevaluate
Type Parameters
Name Description
T

EvaluateAndIgnore<T>(IEnumerable<T>)

Forces the evaluation of an IEnumerable and ignores the result. This can be useful when composing a series of actions to occur, but not needing a result to return.

Declaration
public static void EvaluateAndIgnore<T>(this IEnumerable<T> enumerable)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<T> enumerable

The target enumerable
Type Parameters
Name Description
T

Iterate<T>(IEnumerable<T>, Action<T>)

Executes an Action on each item in an IEnumerable.

Declaration
public static IEnumerable<T> Iterate<T>(this IEnumerable<T> enumerable, Action<T> action)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<T> enumerable

The target enumerable
System.Action<T> action

The action to perform
Returns
Type Description
System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<T>

The item from the collection unmodified
Type Parameters
Name Description
T
Remarks

An example:

values
    .Iterate(Console.WriteLine)
    .ToList();
